item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – October 18, 2019
item.description: Dear Children, How are you doing im [sic] good. What did you guys do this weekend & did you guys have school monday [sic] or were you off for Colombus day [sic]. I had monday [sic] off from the classes im [sic] going to. Thanksgiving is in just a few more weeks. I hope you have a nice big dinner with all of the family. Have you been good this year cause Christmas is

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – October 10, 2019
item.description: Dear Dillan, Ashley, Dwyane & Daniel, Hey kids this is your father Daniel. how are your guys doing this week? Did you guys have a fun weekend, even as an adult my favorite part of the week is the weekend. It’s the time to rest, reflect, and spend time with God so you can thank him for all the blessings he has given you all week. I love all of you guys so much, just thanking [sic] of you brings

item.title: Letter from Rebecca Moffett – December 22, 2016
item.description: December 22, 2016 Dear David and Lesa Williams, I was touched to receive your letter last night. First, I would like to personally thank you both for taking in and caring for Daniel’s babies. As a single mother, I know how difficult and yet how rewarding raising children can be. I felt extreme guilt for not being able to take them in myself, but my prayers were answered, when a lovely couple, such as yourselves, were willing to keep the kids together.

item.title: Stephanie Helton Email – Namesakes for the Children
item.description: I’m passing this along to you. Stephanie Helton, FCM – Martin Co.   Good Morning, Ms. Hulsey requested that I provide the namesakes for the children to you so that you can provide it to the foster/adoptive parents.   Dillan Levi – I choose Dillan’s first name the day he was born, the moment I saw his face the name came to me. I picked Levi as his middle name after a dear family friend who had passed, Dustin Levi Kelley.
